page.title: 19FIRE SERVICES
page.content: Our local fire station is situated on the Hagley Road.Most of the time when firemen can't get water they use a hydrant.The station is used for fighting fire,accidents,pumping water from floods and rescuing people.So the fire service is very important. The fire station at Hasbury was opened in 1963.It covers the Halesowen area but sometimes the engines are called out to places further away.There are two engines at Hasbury but in the daytime only one of them is allowed to go to a fire because the other is a part-time fire engine.There are 33 firemen at Hasbury.They have to keep the engines and equipment clean and ready for use.They have to check pavement hydrants,clubs and halls to make sure they are safe.
